metadata.title: CVE-2023-6931 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
A heap out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the Linux kernel's PerformanceEvents system component can be exploited to achieve local privilegeescalation. A perf_event's read_size can overflow, leading to an heapout-of-bounds increment or write in perf_read_group(). We recommendupgrading past commit 382c27f4ed28f803b1f1473ac2d8db0afc795a1b.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6931` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
